headline.main: ALLIES BOMB BRIDGE ON NEW GUINEA ROAD; Hit New Span on Enemy Supply Route -- Salamaua Pounded

lead_paragraph: ALLIED HEADQUARTERS IN AUSTRALIA, Thursday, April 1 (AP) -- Striking at the important Madang-Wewak highway, running 200 miles along the New Guinea northeast coast, Allied planes yesterday hit a large new bridge and bombed the road at various points in blows to disrupt this strategic Japanese artery of supply.
abstract: Allied planes bomb Madang-Wewak road, Salamaua area and Babo airdrome
